metadata.Title: CVE-2017-15289 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
The mode4and5 write functions in hw/display/cirrus_vga.c in Qemu allow local OS guest privileged users to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds write access and Qemu process crash) via vectors related to dst calculation.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15289` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
qemu-block-extra - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
qemu-guest-agent - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
qemu-kvm - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
qemu-system - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
qemu-system-arm - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
qemu-system-common - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
qemu-system-data - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
qemu-system-gui - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
qemu-system-mips - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
qemu-system-misc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
qemu-system-ppc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
qemu-system-s390x - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
qemu-system-sparc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
qemu-system-x86 - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
qemu-system-x86-microvm - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
qemu-system-x86-xen - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
qemu-user - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
qemu-user-static - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
qemu-utils - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qemu package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1').
